definitions: To cause to fall or collapse.
To reduce to a lower level or amount.
To cause a government or leader to lose power.
To cause an aircraft to crash or land forcefully.
To make someone unhappy or depressed.
examples: The strong winds brought down several trees.
We need to bring down the cost of living.
The scandal threatened to bring down the government.
Anti-aircraft fire brought down the enemy plane.
Don't let his negativity bring you down.
